question_stem.en: A 15-year-old girl is evaluated due to persistent fever, fatigue, and sore throat. Physical examination reveals splenomegaly and symmetric posterior cervical lymphadenopathy. Peripheral blood smear results are shown in the image below {{exhibit_1}}.
question_stem.zh: 一名15岁女孩因持续发热、疲劳和咽喉痛就诊。体格检查显示脾肿大和对称性后颈淋巴结肿大。外周血涂片结果见下图{{exhibit_1}}。

question.en: The atypical cells seen here are most likely an activated form of which of the following?
question.zh: 此处所见的异型细胞最有可能为以下哪种细胞的活化形式？

explanation.en:
This patient's fever, fatigue, sore throat, splenomegaly, symmetric posterior cervical lymphadenopathy, and atypical lymphocytosis are characteristic of INFECTIOUS MONONUCLEOSIS (IM). After entering the bloodstream through the pharyngeal mucosa and tonsillar crypts, the Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) preferentially infects B lymphocytes by binding to CD21 cell surface receptors. EBV-infected B lymphocytes then activate cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CD8+) through the presentation of viral antigens on major histocompatibility complex class I molecules. These reactive (atypical) CD8+ T lymphocytes are the primary immune response to EBV and clonally expand to destroy virus-infected cells.

Atypical lymphocytes make up more than 10% of the cells in a peripheral blood smear in IM, and most (>95%) of those cells are CD8+ T lymphocytes. They classically appear much larger than quiescent lymphocytes, with abundant basophilic cytoplasm and a cell membrane that conforms to the borders of neighboring cells. Although activated CD21+ B lymphocytes and CD4+ helper T lymphocytes can have a similar appearance in response to EBV infection, they make up <5% of the atypical lymphocytes in the peripheral circulation (Choices A and D).

(Choice C) Monocytosis can be seen with chronic infections and may be associated with persistent fever, fatigue, and splenomegaly; however, monocytes typically have vacuolated, grayish cytoplasm.

(Choice E) Activated plasma cells appear as ovoid cells with abundant cytoplasm and an eccentric nucleus with a spoke-wheel chromatin pattern. A zone of perinuclear clearing within the cytoplasm may also be noted, corresponding to the active Golgi body.

Educational objective:
The primary immune response to Epstein-Barr virus is mediated by CD8+ T lymphocytes, which are activated through the presentation of viral antigens on infected CD21+ B lymphocytes. These reactive (atypical) CD8+ T lymphocytes can be observed in the peripheral blood smears of patients with infectious mononucleosis. {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}}
explanation.zh:
该患者的发热、疲劳、咽喉痛、脾肿大、对称性后颈淋巴结肿大和异型淋巴细胞增多症是传染性单核细胞增多症（IM）的特征。爱泼斯坦-巴尔病毒（EBV）通过咽粘膜和扁桃体隐窝进入血流后，优先感染B淋巴细胞，通过与CD21细胞表面受体结合。EBV感染的B淋巴细胞随后通过在主要组织相容性复合体 I 类分子上呈递病毒抗原激活细胞毒性T淋巴细胞（CD8+）。这些反应性（异型）CD8+ T淋巴细胞是EBV的主要免疫反应，并克隆性扩增以破坏病毒感染的细胞。

异型淋巴细胞在外周血涂片中占IM细胞的10%以上，其中大多数（>95%）为CD8+ T淋巴细胞。它们通常比静止的淋巴细胞大得多，具有丰富的嗜碱性细胞质和符合相邻细胞边界的细胞膜。虽然激活的CD21+ B淋巴细胞和CD4+辅助T淋巴细胞在对EBV感染的反应中可能具有相似的外观，但它们在外周循环中占异型淋巴细胞的<5%（选项A和D）。

（选项C）单核细胞增多症可见于慢性感染，并可能与持续性发热、疲劳和脾肿大相关；然而，单核细胞通常具有空泡状、灰色的细胞质。

（选项E）激活的浆细胞表现为卵圆形细胞，具有丰富的细胞质和偏心核，具有车轮状染色质模式。还可能注意到细胞质内细胞核周围的透明区，对应于活跃的高尔基体。

教育目的：
针对爱泼斯坦-巴尔病毒的主要免疫反应是由CD8+ T淋巴细胞介导的，CD8+ T淋巴细胞通过在受感染的CD21+ B淋巴细胞上呈递病毒抗原而被激活。这些反应性（异型）CD8+ T淋巴细胞可在传染性单核细胞增多症患者的外周血涂片中观察到。{{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}}

summary.en:
This question tests knowledge of infectious mononucleosis (IM) caused by Epstein-Barr virus (EBV) and the immune response involving atypical CD8+ T lymphocytes. It also assesses the ability to recognize atypical lymphocytes on a peripheral blood smear.

To solve this question, recognize the clinical presentation of IM and understand that the primary immune response involves CD8+ T lymphocytes. Eliminate other cell types based on their typical morphology and role in EBV infection.
summary.zh:
此题考察对爱泼斯坦-巴尔病毒（EBV）引起的传染性单核细胞增多症（IM）的了解以及涉及异型CD8+ T淋巴细胞的免疫反应。它还评估了在外周血涂片上识别异型淋巴细胞的能力。

为了解决这个问题，要认识到IM的临床表现，并了解主要免疫反应涉及CD8+ T淋巴细胞。根据其他细胞类型的典型形态学和在EBV感染中的作用来排除它们。
